messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 37 years old, male, of White descent. You have some college education and an annual income of $55,000 - $74,999. English is their first language. You are 31.0 feet tall and weighs 280 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I believe I have the full capacity to obtain, process and understand health information and services. I am able to search for information I don't understand or ask to assistance in having it explained to me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I feel I can trust my primary care physician because he has shown me that the decisions he helps me make about my health are the ones that are best for me. My doctor is also very clear about the decisions he makes.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am most anxious about visiting a doctor's office when I have a problem related to my heart. I am worried it might be something serious.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My experience of knowledge about medical issues is related to a heart condition I have. I am knowledgeable in general about it and about the medication I take for it. I know what the medication is supposed to do and what effects it has on my body.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 22 years old, female, of Multiracial or biracial descent. You have some college education and an annual income of $20,000 - $34,999. English is their first language. You are 28.0 feet tall and weighs 145 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel pretty confident in myself. I am pretty young for an adult still, but I believe I am pretty competent and confident enough to understand what needs to be done pertaining to my doctor and my health.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust what is said, but sometimes I feel like I am not a person to my doctor, and he could misread my symptoms.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel anxious when I walk into a new doctor office. I also hate going to some doctors because they are slow or way too quick in my opinion.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My cadets used to have breathing problems occasionally when we would exercise. Sometimes they passed out. It was my duty to help them stabalize.

You have some college education and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is their first language. You are 30.0 feet tall and weighs 140 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel like I am generally able to obtain, process, and understand basic health information. I feel like the information is generally easy to understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I generally trust my primary care physician because she has been my doctor for a long time. I trust what she has to say as she has not given me any reason to not trust her yet.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I usually feel anxious when going to the doctor because I am afraid of what could be wrong with me. I worry about an illness or something and that it might be more serious than it actually appears.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I went to my yearly physical I was offered a vaccination and was given the options of whether or not to receive it after being told the potential benefits and side effects.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel 100% confident answering question accurately and with no problem when talking to nurse or doctor, I might have questions but coherent enough to ask proper questions to receive correct answer.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I have known my doctor for years, he takes care of my family and know and trust him to make careful and thoughtful decisions concerning my health.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Concerned about my over all health and diagnosis that he gives me, but more concerned about his nurses following through with scheduling and medical insurance.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I do not know medical terminology at all and have no interest in medical terminology, I only understand plain English without the medical jargon.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I can totally understand all my medical issues because if I am unsure about anything I will surely seek out any information I need to fully understand my situation.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I have been with my doctor for 14 years. We have develop a relationship of honesty and trust on both sides. I 100%, totally trust my doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
my quarterly lab results sometimes may make me feel anxious. As I get older I sometimes worry about something urgent like cancer.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I actually gave someone CPR when they past out while working out at the gym. When the ambulance came I was informed that I saved the person's life.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
Regarding myself I can honestly say that it is rarely easy for me to understand the information that is given to me in order for me to make the correct health decisions about my health.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think that my doctor is a decent person whom wants to make sure his patients lead a very healthy life. His job is more than a pay check. He's doing an excellent job by providing the necessary help to his patients.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

When visiting a doctor's office I feel anxious about any health situations that might be brought up when having a discussion with my doctor. I need to know that everything will be fine and that a serious illness will not occur.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I was well of a high amount of knowledge of medical health care issues when being asked questions from my doctor so that I can understand the information about my body.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 53 years old, female, of White descent. You have some college education and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is their first language. You are 27.0 feet tall and weighs 153 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel very confident in my ability to communicate my symptoms and concerns to the doctor and then ask questions to clarify my understanding when they give a diagnosis.  I ask a LOT of questions and then I go home and do a little more research online.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care person is a local Nurse Practitioner.  She is busy but never seems rushed while visiting with me about my concerns.  She listens and then asks questions to be sure she understands.  She explains the reason she will chose a certain treatment or why she's choosing to wait and see rather than treat right away.  I like that she doesn't talk down to me and treats me as though I am intelligent enough to understand.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
By the time I get to the doctor I've often thought of all the most terrible things my symptoms could be and though I know the worry is mostly unfounded, I am still anxious until I'm proven wrong.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My husband's cholesterol is high.  We talked to the doctor and then looked up information to see what target number we needed to get him to.  Then we researched on our own and followed information the doctor gave us to determine the changes we could make in our diet and exercise program to help bring his cholesterol down.  We were able to facilitate that change enough in 6 months to avoid needing to have him take medication.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
She is amazing and extremely knowledgeable. She makes time for me whenever I need to see her and she provides updates results within 24 hours.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Maybe in the beginning when I am waiting for the test to be taken and then when I am waiting for the results.  There is a sense of wanting everything to continue to be okay and most of the time it is.

i was having which i thought was the flu; but when i started wheezing and bronicit coughing, i knew it was probably much more.like acute brochitis or something of that nature.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Doctor now a days don't act concern I at all  always in s hurry and don't listen my doctor prescribed me meds and my other doctor asked why was I taking two meds that shouldn't go together. I was so mad.

Becoming a victim of COPD and also arthritis in my shoulders back and hips and knees from years of doing CNA work

I have no problem as a rule understanding and reading medical paperwork pertaining to my medical condition or conditions, but if I do, I ask mym doctor or my nurse. I get printouts each time I see my doctor that arwe relatively easy to follow.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my primary care doctor because he knows me well and has bewen my provider since 2002. Sometimes I feel he knows me better than me medically and personally.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I try to gety the first or second appt of the day because I worry sometimes that the time I am at my doctor will drag out for hours wasting my time that I could be doing other things with my day.

I was diagnosed with colon cancer in 2002 and had been very familiar with this due to my father having had colon cancer five times throughout his life before he passed away. Very familiar with tests and precautions to take.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

When I have symptoms associated with diseases that are tough to treat. I have lung disease so especially worried when I get a infection

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand what I need to do for my health. The problems that I have had in the process usually have been because the doctors don't have enough time for me or don't care explain anything because they think their patients are too dumb to understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

As to doctors in general, I don't trust them completely because they will often do what is best for them rather than what is best for the patient. For instance, they may not prescribe a patient with chronic pain the right medication because they don't want to prescribe certain drugs.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Usually I am in doctorÃ¢ÂÂs office because itÃ¢ÂÂs a last resort and I canÃ¢ÂÂt fix whatever is happening to me so by that point I am pretty worried about what is happening to my body and what may happen in the future.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I noticed my Father was coughing a lot and wheezing. He seemed to be extra weak as well. I thought something serious was happening to him and he thought that he had the a cold. I convinced him to let me bring him to the ER and he was diagnosed with heart failure and they had to put a stint in one of his arteries.

I do have quite a bit of understanding of medical terms. I took 2 years of medical classes as well as chemistry and biology. I also watch a lot of medical diagnosis shows that helps me learn about different conditions. I love learning about these things so I understand a lot of what the doctor is telling me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

He is a great guy and he opens the floor for me if I have any questions. He knows what I need and makes sure my levels are always good. And if its a little off he tries to figure out why the levels are what they are
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

The waiting process is the worst. And if I feel ill or feel something different I never know what it could be. There are so many things that can be wrong with you, and that is what bothers me the most.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I took classes in college for a medical degree. I also took an internship as well and we worked in hospitals and learned about everyday life for doctors

What makes me most anxious is knowing that I don't believe my doctor will listen to me when I say that my hypothyroid symptoms are not getting any better even with the Synthroid dose she has me on

My children have had transplant so I'm quite familiar with liver function tests and when mine were elevated I knew that it was probably my gallstones blocking the common bile duct rather than an actual problem with my liver

My PCP I easy to talk to and seems non judgmental when giving me advice.  Plus she explains  things to me in plain, clear English not a bunch of medical jargon, that's why I trust her.

I am generally concerned about my weight and how it may or may not be affecting my health.  I feel guilty about not exercising as often as I should.

When I was pregnant with my daughter I tested positive for gestational diabetes.  I was not able to manage my glucose levels with just diet alone.  About half way throught I was prescribed medication.

There have been many times when I've wondered what a medicine was supposed to be doing for me, or times when I struggled to fill out forms (about myself!). I think there should be guides for some of these things.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I don't know if I trust doctor's in general, I feel that they may be only looking out for themselves, but I can't pinpoint why. It's probably just distrust for that type in general.

I'm worried that something may be wrong with me!

I just recently changed Doctors and the new one seems to be worse then the one I left.  He might just be to busy or have to many patients.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
He seemed to be in a hurry and it was my first viist to the new Dr. maybe i was just over reacting but that is how i felt.
